title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 is defined in Section 1. Section 2 provides definitions. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development established under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Arts Development Act. It also includes tribally controlled community colleges. The term "tribally controlled community colleges" is defined in the Hawaiian Culture and Art Development Act as per section 4411. The Tribal College Assistance Act of 1978 defines tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions as institutions supported by Section 390(2) of the Tribal Controlled Vocational Institutions Support Act. The term "institutions" has the meaning given by Section 390(2) of the Tribal Controlled Vocational Institutions Support Act of 1990. SEC. 3. Land grant status for tribally controlled community colleges and tribally controlled post-secondary vocational institutions. Land grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, shall be considered land-grant colleges. Land grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, shall be considered land-grant colleges. The applicability of related provisions includes any provision of any Act of Congress relating to the operation of, or provision of assistance to a land-grant college in the United States, Puerto Rico, the District of. Land grant colleges in the United States, Puerto Rico, the District of Columbia, the Virgin Islands, Guam, American Samoa, or the Northern Mariana Islands shall apply to the land grant colleges and institutions described in the same manner and to the same extent. Authorization of. Authorization of appropriations. In lieu of extending to the colleges and institutions described in subsection (a) those provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, relating to donations of public land or land scrip for the endowment and maintenance of colleges. The Act of July 2, 1862, as amended, authorizes appropriations of $10,000,000 for tribal colleges and institutions for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts. Amounts appropriated under this section shall be held and considered for endowment and maintenance purposes. Amounts appropriated under this section shall be held and considered for endowment and maintenance purposes by tribal colleges and institutions. The Act titled "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993" defines the term "Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993". The term "1994 Institutions" in the Act refers to specific colleges including Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, D-Q University, Dullknife Memorial College, Fond Du Lac Community College, Fort Belknap Community College, Fort Berthold Community College, Fort Peck Community College, LacCourte Orielles Ojibwa Community College, Little Big Horn Community College, Little Hoop Community College, and Nebraska Indian Community College. Fort Peck Community College, LacCourte Orielles Ojibwa Community College, Little Big Horn Community College, Little Hoop Community College, Nebraska Indian Community College, Northwest Indian College, Oglala Lakota College, Salish Kootenai College, Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, Standing Rock College, Stonechild Community College, Turtle Mountain Community College, Navajo Community College, United Tribes Technical College. (18) Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, (19) Standing Rock College, (20) Stonechild Community College, (21) Turtle Mountain Community College, (22) Navajo Community College, (23) United Tribes Technical College, (24) Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, (25) Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, (26) Crownpoint Institute of Technology, (27) Haskell Indian Junior College, (28) Leech Lake Tribal College, (29) College of the Menominee Nation. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts in accordance with the Act of July 2, 1862. Any provision of Congress relating to land-grant colleges applies to 1994 Institutions in various regions. 1994 Institutions, established as land-grant colleges for agriculture and mechanic arts, are subject to provisions of Congress applicable to land-grant colleges in the US and its territories. Exceptions apply to Acts assisting agricultural research at colleges eligible under specific legislation. The subsection does not apply to Acts assisting agricultural research at colleges eligible under specific legislation. Authorization of Appropriations: $23,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated to 1994 Institutions instead of extending provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. Amounts granted will be subject to the provisions of that Act applicable to the proceeds from the sale of land or land scrip. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include $50,000 funding for 1994 Institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to provide funding for 1994 Institutions, with specific instructions on how the funds should be allocated and managed. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to provide funding for 1994 Institutions, with specific instructions on how the funds should be allocated and managed. For the fiscal year ending June 30, 1995, and each fiscal year after, $5,000,000 is authorized to be appropriated for the 1994 Institutions for the purposes outlined in section 2. For fiscal year ending June 30, 1995 and onwards, $5,000,000 is allocated for 1994 Institutions for specific purposes. The funds will be distributed through a competitive application process to State institutions established under the Act of July 2, 1862. For fiscal year ending June 30, 1995 and onwards, $5,000,000 is allocated for 1994 Institutions for specific purposes. A competitive applications process will be developed and implemented by the Secretary to distribute the funds to State institutions established under the Act of July 2, 1862. There shall be no matching requirement for funds. For funds allocated to 1994 Institutions, there is no matching requirement. SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and laboratories for research in agriculture. The Research Facilities Act of 1993 is amended to provide grants for 1994 Institutions to improve research facilities in agriculture and sciences. Funding of $1,700,000 is authorized annually from 1995 to 1999 for this purpose. For fiscal years 1995 through 1999, $1,700,000 is authorized annually for grants to 1994 Institutions to improve research facilities in agriculture and sciences. Amend the title to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
